page.title: 13SCORTON HOSPITAL
page.content: In 1912 the old Scorton manor house was pulled down and a much larger hospital was built on the site. During the demolition work,a priest's hole was found.The hospital was a home for poor cripples.It used to run its own farm.Between the two World Wars there was a school for young cripples. In 1977 the Queen Mother opened the new extension.That has a swimming pool and a gymnasium. The hospital costs a lot of money to run.Every year there is a Ball at Scotch Corner Hotel which raises about Â£4,000.In shops and pubs all round here there are collecting boxes where people can put money.The collecting boxes are made in the shape of Brother George because he goes round to collect the money.
